intro: Tridactyle armeniaca, commonly known as Armenian tridactyle, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and parts of Turkey. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible seeds. The plant features slender, upright stems with alternate, lance-shaped leaves that have prominent veins. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Tridactyle armeniaca is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates.
